Jesus_02 11:17am Mon 28 Sep 15 Jesus_02 wrote… All I can say is, I got caught speeding and the driver awareness course was extreamly effective. "skills fade" is something that is widely accepted among businesses and safety crital jobs e.g. Railway workers. Regular theory tests are a) doable online when renewing tax for instance b) easy way to remind drivers of how to drive and update their knowledge. The problem is everyone assumes they are great drivers and its just other peopel. Im sick to death of people saying that they have been "driving for 30 years" as if it makes them immune to being crap drivers. The other issue is that dangerous driving is only ever adressed when an accident happens. 
Punitive heavy deterrent fines and bans are the only answer; governments haven't got the guts to introduce them though; more concerned about saving votes than saving lives. Lobby your MP's mercilessly, or else accept it, and live ( or maybe die) with it.
